indicators.justification:
The information about Gas emissions exists (1)(2)(3)(4)(5) but is outdated. On the other hand, the last national inventory published (2019) has information from 2016 (6)

The country reported to the UNFCCC an document titled "Update of the net emissions goal to 2030 of the Argentina's Second NDC- oct 2021 (7). There, the country informed the methodological updates for the gas measurement.

It is interesting to mention the local action. Many local governments are implementing "Local Climate Action Plans" (8)(9) (10)(11) to face the future challenges.

And there is a future field to discuss because we can find different international organizations with diverse inventories, standars which are considered by the administrative levels of government. To name a few, many cities publish the GEI on the portal of the Disclosure Insight Action , a non profit organization(12)(13)

Finally, it will be very interesting following the guides developed by the Open Data Charter and latin american cases for this matter. See: https://medium.com/opendatacharter/opening-data-on-climate-change-in-uruguay-2c1264a8bac6 

Sources:

Web Sites
(1)http://datos.ambiente.gob.ar/dataset?tags=Emisiones
(2)https://www.datos.gob.ar/dataset/ambiente-emisiones-gases-efecto-invernadero-gei
Reports
(3)https://www.argentina.gob.ar/sites/default/files/inventario_de_gei_de_2019_de_la_republica_argentina.pdf
(4)Third bi-annual Report of Argentina to the  United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) https://unfccc.int/documents/201965
(5)https://inventariogei.ambiente.gob.ar/
(6)https://www.argentina.gob.ar/sites/default/files/inventario_de_gei_de_2019_de_la_republica_argentina.pdf (7) https://www4.unfccc.int/sites/ndcstaging/PublishedDocuments/Argentina%20Second/Actualizacio%CC%81n%20meta%20de%20emisiones%202030.pdf
(8) Local Action Plan. IE. Rosario city. Retrieved from https://www.rosario.gob.ar/web/ciudad/medio-ambiente/plan-local-de-accion-climatica-rosario-2030

(10)RAMCC:https://ramcc.net/noticia.php?id=941

indicators.justification:
Argentina had a National Biodiversity Strategy(2016-2020)(1), a National Advisory Commission for the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biological Diversity (CONADIBIO) (2) and count with research institutes supporting the national information framework.
On the one hand, the country developed the Information Enviromenmtal Center (3) and on the other one exist the Biodiversity Information System under the Natural Parks authority.(4)

There are civil society organizations researching this issue as: Vida Silvestre, FARN.
Also, International organizations monitoring the theme and working closed to national researchs centres/institutes. IE:Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services


Finally, Argentina is in the final stages of developing a revised NBSAP for the 2014-2020 period. Report is still in a draft document. (Biodiversity Convention)(5)



Sources:
(1) Biodiversity Plan. Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/sites/default/files/estrategia-biodiversidad_2016-2020.pdf

(4) SIB site. Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/parquesnacionales/sib

indicators.justification:
The national daily reports about COVID emergency situation are given in multimedia format (TV; YOUTUBE), uploaded on a web site. There are different types of reports: 
(1) Daily reports and monthly reports
(2) Online Coronavirus Situation Room  - Ministry of Health 
 
At subnational and local level exist some examples of open data Covid initiatives. (3) (4) (5)
CIPPEC published a report during 2020 about the use of open data by subnational level.(6) (7)

However, there are limitations related to the reuse, machine-readeable formats between the different source of data, real-time information in open data format. The dashboard developed for real time covid data has not an real historic and interactive interface/downloaded option of data published(8)

A general and national open data information about covid cases is on the open data portal (9). Also, the locals open data portals have datasets of the issue.
Finally, it will be a challenge the progress of data science and open data reuse of Covid information as is proposal by researching initiatives. IE ARPHAI Project. (10) 

Sources:
(1) Daily reports. National level. Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/informes-diarios/reportes/septiembre2021 
(2) Situation Room Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/salud/coronavirus-COVID-19/sala-situacion
(3) Santa Fe Covid Open Data. Retrieved from https://www.santafe.gob.ar/ms/covid19/tablero/
(4) Buenos Aires City Covid Open Data. Retrieved from https://www.buenosaires.gob.ar/coronavirus/datos/gestion-sanitaria

(7) Cippec Monitoring Report. Retrieved from https://www.cippec.org/publicacion/gestionando-con-datos-la-pandemia-por-covid-19/ 
(8) Example. See Image of metadata of covid cases on the open data portal on the supporting evidence field. Status incomplete.

indicators.justification:
To put this issue into context:
1-The most recent national agricultural census was conducted in 2018 (1). In that report, 594,064 lands were surveyed with a total area of 206,690,905.9 hectares, of which 508,676 lands (168,837,695.4 hectares) are for agricultural and forestry use.
2- Acording to Global Forest Whatch: In 2010, Argentina had 37.6Mha of natural forest, which extended over 14% of its territorial extension. In 2020, it lost 187kha of natural forest (2)
3-Exits initiatives to improve the geo data related to lands. See: Idera, ANIDA, IGN projects, organizations.
4-ON the open data portal, the main issue related to this issue is derived from an environmental view. Protected areas are informed.(3)
5-Production use of land  is available by type of commodity. In case of industrial forest the data is available into the map. (4) 



Sources:
(1) Last Agro Census data. Retrieved from https://www.indec.gob.ar/indec/web/Nivel4-Tema-3-8-87
(2) Forest whatch Argentina. Retrieved from https://bit.ly/FWArgentina
(3)Open data Protected areas.Retrieved from http://datos.ambiente.gob.ar/
(4) Industrial forest data. Retrieved from http://snmb.ambiente.gob.ar

indicators.justification:
The issue about land tenure data is diverse. For that, the information found is available from differents sources. In many cases, the availabity is given for  an online procedure related to electronic gov policies. So, the main tenure data is digitalized, but not public , open.
Also, that procedures are not free.
It is also an item to be considered by the future landscape of open data policies.

Finally, it can be discussed if the existence of a map for extranjerization of land (just a part of type of data related to land field) give the justification needed to considerer the entire land field covered and with online availability in any form. It also is because the date of the map is not detailed.


Some notes:

a) The last national census of land tenure (agro) was during the year 2018.The main census of poblation (include land tenure data) was delayed by COvid emergency.(2)

b- Exists a register (3) for family-based agriculture (RENAF)but the certification of this activity is not synonymous of land tenure for this actors. The dataset on the open data portal related to tenure for familiar agro status is outdated. 

c-The information about National Fiscal Land(4) is not online. ( to do this is needed to use the Access to Public Information channel)
At subnational level the Santa Fe province is developing a unique register for that matter. See:https://www.santafe.gov.ar/noticias/noticia/268118

d- Exists a interactive map about the "extranjerización" of lands (5).  Cover data by subnational level and local administratives item. This map has not a date of publication.

e- The cadastre national and subnational office has geospatial data without land tenure data. (6)

f- Many external sites has info about land tenure and open data for lands. However, the info for the country is outdated or is empty. List of sources for future consideration and research(7)

Sources:
(1) The extranjerization map is derived form Ley de Tierras Rurales 26737 by subnational level.
(2) Agro Census (2018). Retrieved from https://www.indec.gob.ar/indec/web/Nivel4-Tema-3-8-87
(3) Agro Register data. Retrieved from https://datos.agroindustria.gob.ar/dataset/f0954546-e012-4c45-98ed-f12a8b677c63/archivo/3b98dcf6-9a26-4ad4-93a5-849c432452b5
(4) Fiscal Land Info. Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/bienesdelestado
(5) Extranjerization map. Retrieved from https://www.argentina.gob.ar/justicia/tierrasrurales/cartograf%C3%ADa/extranjerizacion-provincia
(6) Apis and cadastre by Buenos Aires province sites and City of Buenos Aires. Retrieved from http://www.arba.gov.ar/geoarba/inicio.asp ; https://data.buenosaires.gob.ar/dataset/api-consulta-datos-catastrales-caba
(7) Alternatives sources of data of land to future consideration:
(7.a) Global Forest Watch. COntext data for uses and impacts to forest issue.Link:https://www.globalforestwatch.org/
(7.b) Land Portal. The country has not a profile. Link:https://landportal.org/
(7.c) Land Matrix. Outdated for Arg. Link:https://landmatrix.org/
(7.e) Observatorio nacional de degradación de tierras y desertificación (Argentina). Link:http://www.desertificacion.gob.ar/
(7.f) GEOPORTAL IGN - INSTITUTO GEOGRÁFICO NACIONAL. Link:https://geoportal.ign.gob.ar/

indicators.justification:
The country contains public information about Procurement  sector but the entire information is not open.(1) 
 

We can find open data related to the issue in a fragmented way. There is a Open data portal (general), an open data Road portal (2) and Health open data site (3). 

That situation makes evident the following issues:
a) lack of open data
b) Poor linked works between publics areas, bodys. Each ministry develop a site for publish dataset. The open data portal not centralized all the information.
c) The open data sites uses differents licences
d) The covid context prioritized types of contracts (directs) and the topics
e) Exists an interesting case of uses of open contracting standards. Further info here: https://www.open-contracting.org/2020/05/12/a-data-review-of-the-open-data-portal-by-argentinas-road-authority/ 


Finally, it is important to mention the subnational level agendas. At this moment the Rosario City is part of OGP Local. The city had a proccess where included some initiatives related to open contracting issues. Ie: Open Data Day 2021 hold by Acción Colectiva & OGP Action Plan 2021 (4) 

Sources:
(1) Contratar site. Retrieved from https://contratar.gob.ar/ 
(2) Road OD Portal. Retrieved from https://datosabiertos.vialidad.gob.ar/ui/index.html
(3) Health Open data portal. Retrieved from http://datos.salud.gob.ar/ 
(4) Rosario Topics Proposal Phase of OGPLocal. Retrieved from  https://participa.rosario.gob.ar/processes/planaccion/f/79/proposals/497)

indicators.justification:
The Law of Ethics in the Exercise of Public Function (1) requires strict filings in relation to assets declaration. A large number of public officials of the three branches of the State must present these declarations, as can be seen in the aforementioned regulations.
There are differences mainly between the different powers of the State. The patrimonial declarations are presented in different offices. Executive,  centralized in the Anti-Corruption Office, which is the one who publishes it, but the Legislative keeps it in the Administrative Secretariat of each Chamber. In the case of the Judiciary, it is the administration of the Judicial Power who keeps this information.
Regarding the control of the declarations, there is only control over the patrimonial declarations of the National Executive Power by the Anti-Corruption Office.
The responses to this questionnaire focused on the asset declarations of the executive branch.

Sources: 
(1) http://servicios.infoleg.gob.ar/infolegInternet/anexos/60000-64999/60847/texact.htm
